ARC Symmetric Multi-Processor (SMP) Example¶

Overview¶

This example is designed to show how SMP works and is supported in embARC BSP

Detailed Description¶

  • Extra Required Tools

    NO

  • Extra Required Peripherals

    NO

  • Design Concept

    This example is designed to show how SMP works and is supported in embARC BSP. Core 0 is the master core and will start other slave cores. Cores will do simple inter-core communication through inter-core interrupt.

Note

Hardware support: all DesignWare® ARC® processors based platform with multi arc processors configured

Building and Running¶

To run this example, better to use MetaWare Development Toolkit as mdb has better debug support of multi-core.

Taking HS Development Kit as example, the commands to run this example are as follows:

$ cd <embarc_root>/example/arc_feature/multicore
$ make BOARD=hsdk TOOLCHAIN=mw mp_run
